result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick E Gray was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 6-4-20; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes: Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor.

Restitution set at zero.
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge.
Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers.
Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.
Successfully complete a Parenting Program.
Successfully complete a Batterer's Intervention Program.
May not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Patrick E Gray in court with attorney Vincent P Guimont.  Defendant Patrick E Gray in custody.  Randy P Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
AS TO COUNT 1:
  Defendant  advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.
AS TO COUNT 2:
 Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered Count 2 DISMISSED and READ IN.
   Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 6 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 0 days.
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at zero
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 6/4/2020; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 6/4/2020; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any couseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-Employment or school
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Successfully complete a Parenting Program
-Successfully complete a Batterer's Intervention Program
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Defendant Patrick E Gray in court with attorney Vincent P Guimont.  Defendant Patrick E Gray in custody.  Randy P Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held, defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 15.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Patrick E Gray in court with attorney Vincent P Guimont.  Defendant Patrick E Gray in custody.  Hanna Kolberg for Randy P Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.    Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Patrick E Gray in court with attorney Vincent P Guimont.  Defendant Patrick E Gray in custody.   Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant enters a plea of not guilty as to misdemeanor count 2.
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 6, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
